gameEngine

Class Player

  • java.lang.Object
    • gameEngine.Player

  • public class Player
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents each player in the game. The players have a number of armies with which they can participate in battles. Each player also has a set of countries that are owned by him. The player can place these armies in any f his owned countries. The players also get a card after each turn, these cards can be exchanged for armies.
    Version:
    1.0.0
    Author:
    Shivani

      • getCardExchangeCount

        public int getCardExchangeCount()
        This method gives the count for the number of cards that a player has. The player gets a card after each turn. When a player captures the last country of another player, the winning player gets all the cards of the defeated player.
        Returns:

      • setCardExchangeCount

        public void setCardExchangeCount(int cardCount)
        This method gives the count for the number of cards that a player has. The player gets a card after each turn. When a player captures the last country of another player, the winning player gets all the cards of the defeated player.
        Parameters:
        cardCount - cannot be more than 5

      • winner

        public java.lang.String winner(Country attackingCountry,
                               Country defendingCountry,
                               int noOfDiceForAttackingCountry,
                               int noOFDiceForDefendingCountry,
                               java.lang.String action)
        This function decides whether the attacking country or defending country wins
        Parameters:
        attackingCountry - attacking country object
        defendingCountry - defending country object
        noOfDiceForAttackingCountry - number of dice attacker wishes to throw
        noOFDiceForDefendingCountry - number of dice defender wants to throw
        action - this parameter decides whether to attack once or attack until it is possible
        Returns:
        conclusion after attack

      • noOfDiceOnAllOut

        public java.lang.String noOfDiceOnAllOut(Country attackingCountry,
                                         Country defendingCountry)
        This function calculates number of maximum dice each gets in allout mode and then calls winner function to determine the winner
        Parameters:
        attackingCountry - attacking country object
        defendingCountry - defending country object
        Returns:
        conclusion on the winner result

      • attack

        public java.lang.String attack(Country attackingCountry,
                               Country defendingCountry,
                               int noOfDiceForAttackingCountry,
                               int noOFDiceForDefendingCountry,
                               java.lang.String action)
        This function takes care of attack phase of the game and it has all the constraints and criteria
        Parameters:
        attackingCountry - attacking country object from which user wants to attack
        defendingCountrydefending - country object for which user wants to attack
        noOfDiceForAttackingCountry - number of dice to be used for attacking and this is specified by the user
        noOFDiceForDefendingCountry - number of dice to be used for defending and usually it will be maximum number of dice the defender can have at that point of time
        action - action specifies whether to perform all out operation or just one time attack

      • maxNoOfDice

        public java.lang.String maxNoOfDice(Country attackingCountry,
                                    Country defendingCountry)
        This function gives maximum number of dice for particular attacking or defending country
        Parameters:
        attackingCountry - attacking country object is sent from the user
        defendingCountry - defending country object is sent from the user
        Returns:
        provides max number of dice for both and are been appended as a string

      • cardCount

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.Integer> cardCount()
        This method gives the count of each type of card that the player has.
        Parameters:
        player -
        Returns:
        Array of integer type containing the number of cards of each type in the order artillery, infantry, cavalry.

      • getReinforcementArmies

        public boolean getReinforcementArmies(Player player)
        This method returns the number of armies that the player will get in the reinforcement phase of the game. The player gets (Number of countries owned/3) armies if he does not own any continent, otherwise he gets the sum all control values of the continents owned by him.
        Parameters:
        player - Contains all the details of the player.
        Returns:
        The number of armies that the player will get for reinforcement.

      • reinforceArmies

        public boolean reinforceArmies(Player player,
                               Country country,
                               int armies)
        This method is used to make changes in the number of armies in a country when the player is in the reinforcement stage.
        Parameters:
        player - Contains all the details of the player.
        country - Contains all the details of the country that the player chooses to reinforce.
        Returns:
        returns true if the number of armies is successfully updated else false.

      • fortifyArmies

        public static boolean fortifyArmies(Player player,
                                    Country fromCountry,
                                    Country toCountry,
                                    int armies)
        This method is used to perform the fortification stage in the game. In this stage the user can move an army from one country that he owns to another if they are connected.
        Parameters:
        player - Contains the details of the player.
        fromCountry - The country from which the army will be moved.
        toCountry - Thecountry to which the army will be moved.
        Returns:
        true if the fortification was successful, else false.
